title: Merge pull request #139 from nol888/fix-message-selection
message:
Merge pull request #139 from nol888/fix-message-selection

Fix an issue where message text occasionally becomes unselectable.

title: holoirc: work around weird RecyclerView behavior causing TextViews to become unselectable.
message:
holoirc: work around weird RecyclerView behavior causing TextViews to become unselectable.

Occasionally, message TextViews would, despite being marked selectable in the view XML, fail to allow selection (a warning gets printed to logcat when this occurs). The root cause of this issue seems the RecyclerView ViewHolder lifecycle, a part of which involves updating the text displayed in the message TextView before the view is attached to a window. This causes the TextView to internally cache the fact that its view hierarchy does not support selection handles, and therefore disallow selection.

The fix is to call setText to "update" the text after the TextView has been reattached to a window. This forces a call to android.widget.Editor#prepareCursorControllers, and re-allows selection.

The timestamp TextView is not affected due to an implementation detail in how the layout of the RecyclerView items are computed; since the message is marked as being to the right of the timestamp, the code path to calculate the width of the timestamp TextView calls prepareCursorControllers for us.

title: Merge pull request #138 from nol888/fix-scrolling
message:
Merge pull request #138 from nol888/fix-scrolling

holoirc: re-scroll chat log to bottom if necessary

title: holoirc: re-scroll chat log to bottom if necessary
message:
holoirc: re-scroll chat log to bottom if necessary

The default behavior for RecycleView and other ListView-like views when resized (for example, by the soft keyboard) is to anchor its contents to the top. This results in the bottom lines of text being obscured, even when the original view was scrolled all the way to the bottom.

By listening for changes in the RecycleView's scroll state, we can detect whether or not the user has scrolled the log to the bottom, and can then re-scroll when detecting a change in the height of the ListView by listening a layout change event.
